content.description: Sit start on the arete all the way to the left on the larger boulder. Climb up the arete and make dicey moves for the grade on perfect rock. This problem gets its name from an intimidating round boulder the size of a beachball that is right in the fall zone but appears to have rolled away.

Stand start with your right hand on the left edge of the horizontal rail 5 feet up on Don't Pee on the Fire Hydrant and your left hand on slopey or crimpy features to the left. Continue up and to the left into the scoop, and then tick-tack your way up the black water streak on small sidepulls and crimps to gain the jugs at the lip. Be prepared for a proper mantel! This is classic technical climbing.
content.location: Stand start with your right hand on the left side edge of the horizontal rail 5 feet up on Don't Pee on the Fire Hydrant and your left hand on small features to the left.

content.description: Stand start all the way to the right next to a tree in the alcove on the larger boulder. Traverse left all the way and top out.

Sit start at the corner arete on the larger Summitt Boulder on edges about 12 feet left of the problem Slacker. Climb up and right following the arete and top out inches from the tree that is growing against the boulder.
Crouch start and climb face, to the crack just right of Bacon and Eggs. Crux is in the middle.
content.location: On the larger Summit Boulder, start about 4-6 feet left of the problem Glory Daze.

climbs.name: Don't Pee on the Fire Hydrant

content.description: Sit start and make a move up to the huge feature on the wall. Climb up and top out.
content.location: On the larger Summit Boulder, start about 10 feet right of the problem Stone Beachball.

content.description: Sit start in the crack and climb up the good cracks/seams and traverse left at the top to finish just right of the small pine tree.
content.location: On the larger Summit Boulder, start about 8-10 feet left of the problem Glory Daze.

content.description: This is the larger of the two boulders near the summit.
